quoteLast: , when just about to seat herself at table for breakfast, she felt a kind of need, an impulse which prompted her to write;--it was what she called a _trance_,--and she rushed off at once to her large note-book, where she wrote in pencil, with feverish haste, certain undecipherable words.

quoteLast: , and were soon after overtaken by the mansa, accompanied by the Mandingo of Kankan; the latter proved very serviceable to me on this occasion. quoteFirst: The trail starts at ~Mirror Lake~, three miles from Yosemite. One should plan to see sunrise there (
quoteLast: in summer). Skirting the west shore the trail follows up the canyon about one mile, thru a dense forest of oak, laurel, yellow pine, Douglas fir and incense cedar. Then begins a long, hard climb of 2500 feet up 108 switchbacks (one and a half miles--two hours).

quoteFirst: If he was to sell the coat off his back he would do this, I am told, because to fail in so doing would be to prevent his obtaining any stock-money for the future. With this capital he starts on his rounds
quoteLast: , and I am assured he will frequently begin his work without tasting food, rather than break into the borrowed stock-money. Each man has his particular walk, and never interferes with that of his neighbour; indeed, while upon another’s beat he will seldom cry for clothes.
title: London Labour and the London Poor, Vol. 2
author: Mayhew, Henry, 1812-1887
